title.narrative: Promoting Reduction of and Improved Operational Response to Gender-based Violence through Camp Management and Site Planning

description.narrative: Since 2015, IOM has been implementing gender-based violence (GBV) prevention and mitigation activities under the Safe from the Start Initiative supported by US Population Refugees & Migration (PRM). The three-phase project “Promoting the Reduction of and Improved OperationalResponse to Gender-Based Violence through Camp Management and Site Planning has allowed IOM to advance commitments made to the global “Callto Action on Protection from GBV in Emergencies” and develop innovative,operational, context-adaptable tools and approaches to mainstream GBV risk mitigation and prevention into IOM’s three core operational emergency response sectors- Camp Coordination and Camp Management (CCCM), Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) and Shelter. The overall objectives of Phase IV are to pursue and deepen the integration of GBV mainstreaming into CCCM and Shelter emergency response, at both agency and sectoral levels, to ensure more systematic and predictable actions to address GBV risks in displacement and promote effective and accountable inter-agency Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (PSEA) leadership and coordination at all levels of the humanitarian architecture.
